## What is binosim?

An R package that returns a data frame of binary data from sample size, probability of x, baseline probability of Y, and the true odds ratio.

It allows you to explore how changes in sample size, baseline probabilities, and effect sizes impact the results of statistical analyses.

## binosim Function

```{r}
#| echo: true
binosim <- function(n, px, baselineprob, or) {
  x <- rbinom(n, size = 1, prob = px)
  log_odds <- baselineprob + log(or) * x
  py <- exp(log_odds) / (1 + exp(log_odds))
  y <- rbinom(n, size = 1, prob = py)
  dat <- data.frame(y = y, x = x)
  return(dat)
}
```
